THE BIOMES

Life on our planet depends on the energy from the sun, the availability of water, and the existence of nutrients in the soil, among other factors.

But not all regions of the world possess the same conditions.

In each region of the planet there are different climates, landforms, and soil types that generate the environmental conditions for the development of life in that place.

In each region lives a group of beings adapted to the place they inhabit.

For example, in the desert, both plants and animals are adapted to the scarce availability of water.

Living beings that inhabit a region also relate to each other, for example, some are food for others.

Each of the regions where living beings interact with each other and with the place where they live is called an ecosystem.

On Earth, we find similar ecosystems in places that are very distant from each other.

For example, there are jungles and tropical forests in the center of Africa, northern South America, and Southeast Asia.

Ecosystems can be classified into different types called biomes.

For example: jungles, deserts, forests or prairies.
